simpleconfig.keybind.setting.activation:: Choose when should this keybind fire
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.context:hel: Context where this keybind can be fired
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.allow_extra: Allow extra keys to be held down when firing the keybind
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.order_sensi: Require all keys to be pressed in order to fire the keybind
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.exclusive:h:
Only fire the keybind if none others have been triggered in this combo
§7Convenient to have on-release exclusive keybinds for keys used as modifiers by other keybinds
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.match_by_ch:
Match keys in this keybind by their text values, rather than their position in the keyboard
§7Useful for players using multiple keyboard layouts and mnemonic keybinds.
simpleconfig.keybind.setting.prevent_fur: Prevent default (vanilla) processing of the keys that trigger this keybind
simpleconfig.keybind.settings:help:
Advanced Keybind Settings
§7Left Click to edit
§7Right Click to copy
§7Middle Click to paste
simpleconfig.keybind.settings.copied:
Copied settings
§7Use Middle Click to paste
simpleconfig.key.__no_key_just_a_json_co: The colors also help sort the keys in the list, that's why there are multiple formatting colors adjacent redundantly such as §9§a§9
simpleconfig.config.title: %s §7— Config
simpleconfig.config.header: Comments starting with 2 hash symbols (##) are documentation comments and will be reset if modified.
simpleconfig.config.client.menu.add_paus: Adds a button to the pause menu to open the mods list
simpleconfig.config.client.menu.options_:
Replace the options menu with Simple Config's Minecraft mod menu, which wraps them
§7This makes possible to create presets/hotkeys for all Minecraft options
§7A secondary click is either§2 RClick§7 or §2Shift + Click§7
simpleconfig.config.client.menu.add_opti:
Adds a button to the options menu to open Simple Config's Minecraft mod menu, which wraps Minecraft options
§7This makes possible to create presets/hotkeys for all Minecraft options
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.ho:
Where should hotkeys be logged when activated.
§7The chat is the only persistent location.
§7The right overlay is like a temporary chat at the right of the screen.
§7The center toast can only display the title of the hotkey
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.lo:
Log hotkey actions in addition to the hotkey name.
§7Has no effect if the location does not support multiline messages.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.re:
Like the setting above, but applies to hotkeys triggered
by other players when they affect server configuration.
§7Only relevant for server operators, which receive said logs.
§7Keep in mind that only authorized players can modify
§7the server configuration, even through hotkeys.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.lo:
Log remote hotkey actions in addition to the
hotkey name and the player who triggered them.
§7Has no effect if the location does not support multiline messages
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.ma:
Maximum number of actions logged for each hotkey, since hotkeys can affect an arbitrary amount of entries.
§7If hotkeys are not displayed in the chat, you may not be able to read all the actions for a single hotkey.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.ov:
Time to display each hotkey §3(in seconds)
§7Hotkeys may vanish faster if more push them out to a certain height.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkey_log.to:
Relative height of the toast within the screen
§70 is at the bottom, 1 is at the top
Time to display the toast for §3(in seconds)
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm:help: Configure which actions should require confirmation
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.save:: Request confirmation before saving a config
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.disca: Request confirmation before closing a config with unsaved changes
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.overw: Request confirmation before saving a config with conflicting external changes
Request confirmation before saving a config with conflicting remote changes
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.reset: Require a drag movement to reset an entry to its default
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.group: Require a drag movement to reset a group/list/map of entries to its default
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.resto:
Require a drag movement to restore an entry's value before opening the config
§7You can restore entries holding §8[§7Alt§8]§7 when clicking a reset button
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.group:
Require a drag movement to restore a group/list/map of entries to their value before opening the config
§7You can restore entries holding §8[§7Alt§8]§7 when clicking a reset button
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.save_: Request confirmation before saving config hotkeys
simpleconfig.config.client.confirm.disca: Request confirmation before closing config hotkeys with unsaved changes
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.allo:
Allow saving a config with errors
§7Entries with errors will not be saved.
§7This is only supported to work around broken mods that report invalid values when they shouldn't (for instance, for their default values).
§7Report this kind of errors in the mod's issue tracker
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.max_:
Maximum number of actions which can be undone.
§7Set to 0 to disable the limit.
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.show: Display a button next to all entry names to copy their path

Display UI tips (description for list controls and reset buttons)
§7Can be toggled from the controls dialog.
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.allo:
Do not snap the scrollbar to its bounds when the maximum height
decreases, such as when collapsing groups
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.tool:
Maximum tooltip width in screen percentage
§7Not live previewed
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.pref: Maximum number of options allowed in cycling buttons before being transformed into combo boxes
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.cycl: Allow cycling options in selection entries by scrolling over the button
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.max_:
Configure the maximum number of options/suggestions that will be displayed in the config file's comments
§7Entries with many possible options, such as item entries may create very long comments otherwise
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.colo:
These are the colors displayed in the color picker palette
§7You can save them from the color picker using §8[§7Right Click§8]§7
simpleconfig.config.client.advanced.sear:
Search history shared by all config screens
§7You may change the maximum size too
§7Setting it to §30§7 will disable the history

Regular expression search history shared by all config screens
§7You may change the maximum size too
§7Setting it to §30§7 will disable the history
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkeys.open_: Configure a keybind to open the mod list.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkeys.edit_: Configure a keybind to open the config hotkeys dialog.
simpleconfig.config.client.hotkeys.mod_c: Add keybinds to open directly the config menu of specific mods.
simpleconfig.config.common.desc: Simple Config is able to wrap the config of mods that define their configuration files using the Forge API, providing config menus and commands for them.
simpleconfig.config.common.menu.wrap_con:
Provide configuration menus and commands under §7"§3/config§7"§r to edit configs of other mods.
§7Mods that use the Simple Config API always have menus and commands.
§7In order to provide menus for the server config of another mod, it must be enabled both in the client and the server.

Exceptions to the above setting.
§7If enabled, mods in this list will not receive menus nor commands.
§7Otherwise, mods in this list will be the only ones to receive menus & commands.
§7Mods that use the Simple Config API always have menus & commands
simpleconfig.config.common.menu.replace_:
Replace configuration menus of mods that already had one.
§7Only applies to mods that receive menus according to the above settings.

Exceptions to the above setting
§7If enabled, mods in this list won't have their menus replaced
§7Otherwise, the mods in this list will be the only replaced ones.
simpleconfig.config.common.menu.wrap_top: Wraps top level groups in other mods' configs as tabs rather than normal groups.
simpleconfig.config.common.menu.prevent_: Prevents other mods from replacing Simple Config menus
simpleconfig.config.server.desc:
By default, only server operators can modify a mod's server config. However, you may set here specific permissions for each mod/player.
§7Top level operators (%s§7 4) always have access to server configs.
simpleconfig.config.server.permissions.r:
You may define as many roles as you want.
§7A player can belong to many roles.
§7The §8"§a[op]§8"§7 role is reserved for server operators §8(permission level 2 or greater)§r
§7The §8"§a[all]§8"§7 role is reserved and includes all players
simpleconfig.config.server.permissions.m:
Creating mod groups is optional.
§7In the rules you may specify as target both, mods and mod groups.
§8Using mod groups can help make modifications in the future.
§7The §8"§a[all]§8"§7 group is reserved and includes all mods
simpleconfig.config.server.permissions.r:
Rules are applied in order, where the last wins.
§7The permission for each player for each mod is the last one that applies to both.
§7If no rules are present, only top level operators can access the config §8(permission level 4)
simpleconfig.config.server.permissions.h:
Configure which players can save hotkey presets in the server (available to all players).
§7Rules are applied in order, where the last wins.
§7If no rules are present, only top level operators can edit server saved hotkeys §8(permission level 4)
simpleconfig.config.permissions.test.mod: §7Players who can edit server config for mod "%s":
simpleconfig.config.server.end:
Any in-game modification of the server config by any player will be logged and notified to all operators.
§7A server owner can always edit the config files by other means.
simpleconfig.config.enum.PauseMenuButton: Makes the options button smaller and uses part of its space for the mod list button

Changes will not be saved!
Entries with errors will not be saved.
§7Saving a config with errors is only supported to work around broken mods which report config errors when they shouldn't.
§7It won't allow you to save invalid values that could break a mod.

§7If a mod is causing this kind of problems, or you think a reported invalid value should be valid, report it in the mod's issue tracker.

simpleconfig.file.dialog.title: Edit config file manually
simpleconfig.file.dialog.body:
Open file §8"§7%s§8"§r
§6External changes can be detected and merged, but current changes in the GUI aren't synced to the file!§r
If you're planning to edit this config file directly it might be best to discard/save any pending changes.
§7Sometimes, Minecraft may take a while to detect config file changes. You can try to save the file multiple times with spacing changes until the changes are picked here.

This mod doesn't have any client configuration, only server/world related configuration.
Currently, server/world configuration can only be edited while in the server/world.

Select a singleplayer world/multiplayer server to edit this mod's configuration.

§6Experimental setting

§6Advanced setting

simpleconfig.config.error.range_too_smal: Range too small! (must be at least %5.2d wide, but is %5.2d)
simpleconfig.config.error.range_too_larg: Range too large! (must be at most %5.2d wide, but is %5.2d)
simpleconfig.config.client.demo:help: §7Demo category with examples for mod developers
simpleconfig.config.text.greeting_builde:
This is a demo config with examples for mod developers, built with the builder API.
You can read the source for this category at %s
The following are examples of supported config entry types

All number types support sliders,
as long as their bounds are finite
Sliders may display different text in their widgets.
Enums may define their own translations
String entries may suggest possible values
String entries may also be restricted to a finite set of values
An entry may be restricted to a finite set of values using an enum-like interface

It's common for pairs of numeric entries to denote ranges
§7You can group this kind of entries in a single range entry

Ranges can be of long and double types,
and inclusive or exclusive, at each end

Exclusiveness of the range bounds can also be made editable, separately for each end
§7In addition to the button controls, try typing "§3<§7" or "§3=§7" in the range

Lists may contain any other entry type that has an entry in the config file
§7This only excludes static text messages and non persistent boolean entries
List of color lists with captions
Lists may also have a caption entry, even when nested inside other lists
Lists can contain Java Bean entries, which act as groups of entries

Types serializable as strings
§7You may define your own serializers

Combo boxes support advanced text search
§7Try typing '§3gapple§7' in this combo box
§7Hitting '§3Ctrl + Space§7' or '§3Enter§7' will trigger autocompletion

Item entries can also allow unknown items
§7(For example, belonging to unloaded mods)

Modders may define their own string serializers
§7This is just an example, if you just want a pair or triple, please use the built-in ones instead
§7Only use serializable types for types that have a natural representation in text form
§7Most players will prefer editing bean entries instead

It's also possible to edit Java Beans using group-like entries
§7The main use of these entries is within lists or maps
§7Beans can display a small dynamic icon

Maps may contain any other entry type that is serializable as NBT
§7This currently includes all built-in types and all string-serializable types
§7Map keys can be any entry type that serializes as strings except other lists or maps
Of course, maps may contain lists
Map of maps of divisible integers

Of course, maps may contain other maps
§7However, don't push it too far, or the config will stop being§o simple§r
Additionally, this map only allows integers divisible by the caption entry

The keys to a map can be almost any other kind of entry
§7Obviously, not other lists or maps
There are also pair lists, which allow duplicate keys
Maps can be linked, preserving their order
Maps can be useful to map keys to actions

Maps can contain Java Bean entries, allowing for very complex configurations.
§7Beans can have other Beans, or even maps as properties
Entries can be grouped to form pairs or triples.
Almost any entry (save for lists and maps) can be aggregated to form a pair.
Paired entries do not need to be of the same type.
Pairs can contain pairs without a set limit, but users may have trouble editing them in small screens

Any entry can be made %s, appearing only in the GUI and being reset on every restart
This can be useful to enable special debug/profiling features you wouldn't wish to leave on accidentally

Some entries can be marked to not count as edited changes
§7This is useful in cases where they merely control other entries in the GUI.

Button entries can run an arbitrary action
§7For example, they may modify the values of other entries
Non persistent entries may have a button to run any arbitrary action taking the entry value as parameter
The entry above multiplies all elements of this list

Presets can modify the values of other entries
§7This demo presets affect the following group of entries
These entries can be set using the preset entry above
simpleconfig.config.client.demo.errors_t: You may click here to open the %s for no specific reason
Entries may define custom restrictions and error messages

An entry's validation may rely on other entries
§7For example, you cannot set a greater min than max

An entry's validation may rely on other entries
§7For example, you cannot set a greater min than max
List entries may also define a validator for its elements, as well as for the whole list

Some entries require a restart to be effective
§7You'll be notified about it when you save your changes

Entries can be flagged as experimental.
§7Users will see a banner warning them about currently modified experimental entries.
Entries can be flagged as advanced, to warn users to not touch them unless confident.

Entries may be tagged with many different tags.
§7Mods may even create their own.
This entry can disable the one below it
This entry is only editable when the above is §aTrue

Hello, %s!
Tooltips may be dynamic
§7There are various ways to achieve this
simpleconfig.config.client.demo.end: Are you a mod developer willing to create your own §o§5Simple Config§r? You can check how this config was made at the %s
simpleconfig.config.text.greeting_declar:
This is a demo config with examples for mod developers, built with the declarative Java API.
You can read the source for this category at %s
simpleconfig.config.client.declarative_d: This entry was built with the builder API
This is an example text comment. There are several ways to declare text comments in config menus.

A baker method may be used to translate entry units
§7For example, this entry is translated to m/tick on bake
simpleconfig.config.text.some_complex_te: You may use the command "%s" to summon a pink sheep
simpleconfig.config.client.declarative_d:
Slider entries can allow values beyond their slider range.
This entry lets you introduce values between 10 and 20 by switching to text input mode
This entry is mapped to a different range when baked with a custom annotation providing a baking traansformation.
minecraft.config.client.graphics.overrid:
Forced window width
§7Set to 0 to disable

Forced window height
§7Set to 0 to disable
minecraft.config.client.advanced.pauseOn:
Automatically pause the game when another window is focused
§7Pausing in multiplayer worlds does not stop the game from running
minecraft.config.server.gamerule:help: Game rules editable with the §7/gamerule§r command
minecraft.config.server.properties:help: Properties found in the§7 server.properties§r file
minecraft.config.server.properties.prote: Properties that may compromise the server if an untrusted player is able to modify or even read them

Makes protected server properties editable by players from Minecraft's server config menu, where you're probably reading this from.
§6While only players allowed to edit Minecraft's server config in this server can access these properties, exposing this properties accidentally could pose a security risk
§7Disabled by default. When disabled, can only be enabled again by editing the server.properties file directly
Some properties are not editable for security reasons. This may be changed by manually setting §7"§2edit-protected-properties§7"§r to §6true§r in the §3server.properties§r file.

Verify player accounts with Yggdrasil (Mojang authentication)
§7Prevents players from using fake accounts
If the ISP/AS sent from the server is different from the one from Mojang Studios' authentication server, the player is kicked

Enables GameSpy4 protocol server listener
§7Used to get information about server

Enables remote access to the server console
§7It's not recommended to enable RCON, because it transfers everything without encryption (including the password)
minecraft.config.server.properties.pvp:h:
Enables combat between players
§7Otherwise, players cannot attack each other
minecraft.config.server.properties.allow:
Allows players to bypass fly checks from the server
§7This doesn't grant creative flight to players, but allows players to fly with modded clients
§7Enabling this may also prevent kicks due to intense lag
minecraft.config.server.properties.motd:: Message displayed in the Multiplayer server list under the server's name
minecraft.config.server.properties.level: Name of the server folder where the world is saved
minecraft.config.server.properties.hardc:
Enable hardcore difficulty
§7The difficulty is locked to §cHard§r and dead players are not allowed to respawn
minecraft.config.server.properties.spawn:
Radius in chunks around the spawn point where players cannot build/break blocks
§7Setting it to 0 disables spawn protection
§7Servers without operators also have spawn protection disabled
minecraft.config.server.properties.op-pe: Default permission level granted by the §7/op§r command
minecraft.config.server.properties.max-t: Maximum number of milliseconds a tick is allowed to last before diagnosing a server crash
minecraft.config.server.properties.max-c: Limit for the number of times a single chunk update can propagate to neighbors
minecraft.config.server.properties.rate-:
Maximum packet rate a player is allowed to send before being kicked
§7Setting it to 0 disables the limit
minecraft.config.server.properties.view-: Radius of loaded chunks around each player in the server
minecraft.config.server.properties.simul: Radius of updated chunks around each player in the server
minecraft.config.server.properties.netwo: Max size in bytes for uncompressed packets
minecraft.config.server.properties.sync-: Enables synchronous chunk writes to disk, which may cause lag spikes
minecraft.config.server.properties.enabl: Display server as online in the server list
minecraft.config.server.properties.hide-: Hide player list in the server list
minecraft.config.server.properties.entit: Controls how close an entity needs to be to be sent to a player
minecraft.config.server.properties.previ: Send a preview of the formatted chat message to players
minecraft.config.server.properties.playe: Number of minutes before a player is kicked for not moving
minecraft.config.server.properties.enfor: Requires players to have a Mojang-signed public key to join the server
minecraft.config.server.properties.world: Random seed used to generate the world
JSON settings for the world generator
